Home app¶

Views¶

class home.views.NewTopicFormView(**kwargs)¶

Returns the rendered page that is used for writing new topics

The method checks whether the request is GET (the user requested a page used to write a new topic) and POST (the user posted a new topic) The POST method checks if the user is logged in and in that case saves the topic to the database and redirects to that page

form_class¶

alias of TopicPostForm

get(request)¶

Returns the rendered page that is used for writing new topics

post(request)¶

Checks if the user is logged in and in that case saves the topic to the database and redirects to that page

home.views.home(request, show_count=5)¶

Returns the home page

The method filters phones and tablets by a number of views they have and shows the top 5 The topics get shown based on their publish date. By default 5 are displayed, but that can be expended by clicking show more

Keyword arguments: request – HttpRequest object show_count – the number of topics that are currently displayed

home.views.show_more(request, show_count=5)¶

Generates the url that specifies how many topics should be displayed and redirects to that page

Keyword arguments: request – HttpRequest object show_count – the number of topics that are currently displayed
